Line 62: Line 62:
===Build conference and developer preview===
===Build conference and developer preview===
â
Microsoft unveiled new Windows 8 features and improvements on September 13, 2011, day one of the BUILD developer conference.<ref name="W8PreviewGuide">{{cite web|url=http://download.microsoft.com/download/1/E/4/1E455D53-C382-4A39-BA73-55413F183333/Windows_Developer_Preview-Windows8_guide.pdf |title=Windows 8 Developer Preview Guide |format=PDF |date= |accessdate=2011-09-16}}</ref> Microsoft also released a Developer Preview build (Build 8102) of Windows 8 for the developer community to download and start working with.<ref name=BUILD>{{cite web |title=Windows BUILD by Microsoft |url=http://www.buildwindows.com/}}</ref> Windows 8 Developer Preview can be installed on virtualization platforms including [[VMware Workstation]]<ref>{{cite web|author=Tony John, Microsoft MVP |url=http://www.mywindowsclub.com/resources/5081-Install-Windows-VMWare-Workstation.aspx |title=Install Windows 8 on VMWare Workstation}}</ref> and [[VirtualBox|Oracle VirtualBox]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Tony John, Microsoft MVP |url=http://www.mywindowsclub.com/resources/5084-How-install-Windows-Oracle-VM-VirtualBox.aspx |title=Install Windows 8 on Oracle VirtualBox}}</ref> The host's CPU must support [[hardware virtualization]], and the virtualization usage - enabled in VM, in order for the installation to succeed.
+
Microsoft unveiled new Windows 8 features and improvements on September 13, 2011, day one of the BUILD developer conference.<ref name="W8PreviewGuide">{{cite web|url=http://download.microsoft.com/download/1/E/4/1E455D53-C382-4A39-BA73-55413F183333/Windows_Developer_Preview-Windows8_guide.pdf |title=Windows 8 Developer Preview Guide |format=PDF |date= |accessdate=2011-09-16}}</ref> Microsoft also released a Developer Preview build (Build 8102) of Windows 8 for the developer community to download and start working with.<ref name=BUILD>{{cite web |title=Windows BUILD by Microsoft |url=http://www.buildwindows.com/}}</ref> Windows 8 Developer Preview can be installed on virtualization platforms including [[VMware Workstation]]<ref>{{cite web|author=Tony John, Microsoft MVP |url=http://www.mywindowsclub.com/resources/5081-Install-Windows-VMWare-Workstation.aspx |title=Install Windows 8 on VMWare Workstation}}</ref> and [[VirtualBox]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Tony John, Microsoft MVP |url=http://www.mywindowsclub.com/resources/5084-How-install-Windows-Oracle-VM-VirtualBox.aspx |title=Install Windows 8 on Oracle VirtualBox}}</ref> The host's CPU must support [[hardware virtualization]], and the virtualization usage - enabled in VM, in order for the installation to succeed.
Microsoft has shown a development roadmap at the BUILD conference stating that the next milestone will be Beta, Release Candidate, [[Software_release_life_cycle#RTM|RTM]], and general availability.
Microsoft has shown a development roadmap at the BUILD conference stating that the next milestone will be Beta, Release Candidate, [[Software_release_life_cycle#RTM|RTM]], and general availability.
